Job Title: Project Manager/Scrum Master - Chief Accounting Office - Finance & Administration

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
The energy of a newsroom, the pace of a trading floor, the buzz of a recent tech breakthrough; we work hard, and we work fast - while keeping up the quality and accuracy we're known for. It's what keeps us inventing and reinventing, all the time. Our culture is wide open, just like our spaces. We bring out the best in each other through collaboration. Through our countless volunteer projects, we also help network with the communities around us, too. You can do amazing work here. Work you couldn't do anywhere else. It's up to you to make it happen.

What's the role?

The Agile Program and Change Management team within our Chief Accounting Office own and drive the project portfolio management, program/project management, change management, and agile/Scrum frameworks for our technology and operational departments within CAO. We support SAP and all related technology including core enterprise, business warehouse and intelligent automation as well business processes including Order to Cash, Source to Pay, Hire to Retire, Payroll and Supply Chain and partner closely with our Engineering teams.

We are looking for an experienced Project Manager, a master facilitator, an impeccable organizer, a believer in the power of agility. You're equally adept at leading large multi-workstream initiatives and rolling up your sleeves as a Scrum Master to enable teams to bring value to their businesses. Your system's mindset is always on the lookout for continuous improvement opportunities. Your communication and follow-through skills keep people informed and on track, and your empathy engenders trust. You work well with a team and perform well under pressure. You lead by example and understand the value of developing and maintaining relationships with stakeholders.

We'll trust you to:

Manage multiple concurrent technical and operational projects with broad influence through effective governance, cross-team organization, proactive management of risks, issues, and dependencies, and leadership engagementAct as Scrum Master on one or more teams:Facilitate Scrum Events effectively (Daily Scrum, Refinement, Planning, Review and Retrospective) Empower the team to embrace continuous improvement and process disciplineCoach the Product Owner to effectively articulate the team's vision and roadmap to the team and stakeholdersContribute to the enhancement and delivery of our frameworks in response to the evolving needs of our organization and teamsInteract with and influence all levels of the organizationBe able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment requiring accountability, good judgment, flexibility, and a hands-on approach

You'll need to have:

Bachelor's Degree or equivalent relevant experience5+ years of project/program management experience5+ years of Scrum Master experience and proficiency with JIRALeadership facilitation experience to drive senior-level decision making through transparency and data/visualizationProven ability to influence and lead with and without authorityExcellent verbal, written, and visual communication skillsStrong organization skills and an eye for detail, balanced by an ability to summarize insights and present to various stakeholders across the organizationA passion for Program Management, Scrum/scaling Scrum and the ability to work in both methodologiesIntellectual curiosity, creativity, and a genuine interest in driving sustainable, positive changeAbility to work independently, solve problems and deal with ambiguityStrong proficiency MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)

We'd love to see:

Experience in full lifecycle program management for large-scale ERP implementations (SAP, Oracle, PeopleSoft)Experience implementing Agile/Scrum to new and existing cross-functional teams, including scaled Scrum frameworks (e.g. Scrum@Scale, SAFe, Kanban)Understanding of Accounting, Order to Cash, Procure to Pay and Payroll processesBig 4 Consulting experience as well as in-house positionsExperience with global implementationsAbility to travel if the need arises (less than 10% of the time)PMP Certification, Scrum Master Certification, proficiency in MS Project 

Does this sound like you?

Apply if you think we're a good match. We'll get in touch to let you know that the next steps are, but in the meantime feel free to have a look at: https://www.bloomberg.com/company/what-we-do/
